title: How to quickly learn to build a mathematical background - Quora

response.answer_text: There is not particularly *quick* way as in the legend of Euclid telling the King, “There is not royal road to geometry.” Of course, one builds most things with the proverbially cliche, “one brick at a time.” And in essence that is the same for math. Start with you present level and build up.

It depends on what you mean “quickly” and how much knowledge you include in the “background”. But I might suggest to take a look at the course “Math 4 Teens” on UNIZOR.COM. It’s free, relatively comprehensive, has a lot of problems and exams. Start from Concepts and feel your way through.
If you want to do it quickly, then you must start by being born with superb mental powers. Otherwise you will have to do it the way you acquire any skill: practice, practice, practice.
